alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 10:47AM CDT until April 20 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain and colder temperatures in the forecast. This is the last statement to be issued for the Snake River below Warren as it has fallen below flood stage. Ice jamming continues to impact Crookston. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Hawley. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Railroad underpass at US Hwy 10 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Monday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue falling to 6.5 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
